< review>
I've been ordering from here quite often for the last 2 and a half years now.
The pizza, wings, and pasta, always seem to get better every time I order.
The staff is always very nice and polite. The food is always nice and hot, etc.
The only "issue" is that they're sometimes a little slow getting here sometimes.
But they're usually busy when we call.</review>

<UserId.>116877968697220327393< /UserId.><Name>Joseph Giles< /Name><Time>1509340599235<//Time><Rating>5<//Rating>< review>
When I called in my order, at first I was bummed they didn't have any more large "Pan" or "Deep Dish" pizzas available. But the manager John, who took my call, told me he would make us 2 medium supreme "Pan" pizzas, but only charge us  for 1 large supreme "Pan" pizza. Because this manager, knows customer service, (which quite frankly is next to impossible to receive anymore THESE days!!!) I will ALWAYS use this Pizza Hut in Apple Valley  off HWY18 and will recommend this store to anyone who may ask me. Thanks Again! John you really met our needs. Thank you!< /review>

<Review>You should be able to give 0 stars...So I came here last month with a flat tire. SO I came in with a flat tire that needed a plug. I had already put the spare on the van. They said the tire was no good anymore. I disagreed, but they kept taking it off the rim and putting on a a new used tire for $30. I kept saying, "NO !" but they wouldn't stop. They took advantage of me being tired from changing the tire and susceptible to their high pressure. And they knew I had a credit card, as everybody does these days. I relented thinking I could be sure of a decent tire for at least half a year. But only a few months later the sidewall on this tire cracked !!!! <Pics>None< /Pics><Rating>1< /Rating><username>Kyky A<//username>< Text>
Tire blew on Saturday.  Scrambled to find anyone open nearby.  Should have called first.  An older fellow came up and asked what I needed.  I gave him the tire size and he claims to only have a brand new tire, no used.  When I asked if he could check, he popped into his office and right back out with the same - no used, only new at $75 total.  He then said that he had a different sized used tire but it would work the same.  I used to work for Sams Club tire center and knew that one whom works with tires should NEVER suggest that you run one different size than the other 3!!!  Safety issue RED FLAG.  So I took the new tire, since it was closer to closing time and didn't wanna drive more in that condition.  I needed to get my check cashed and he quickly saw an opportunity to snag my money so he helped himself to my rim in the trunk and offered to put it on when I was gone and it would be done quicker.  I got back and waited about 15min for my tire to be put back on by a different guy.  When I got home, I figured out why it took so long!  THE YOUNGER MAN WHOM PUT IT BACK ON LOST ONE OF MY ORIGINAL LUG NUTS AND MY CENTER CAP!!!!!  Couldn't even be a man and own up to a mistake like that, such a lack of business sense.. Jesse Soriano</user_name>
<date>1569979417163< /date><rating>4<//rating>< text>
Jose head chef of this true hidden gem of a taqueria offers some of the best pupusas in SF. Delicately flavored w tasty fillings. These corn filled delights will dazzel ur tastebuds and keep u coming back for more. By far some of the best pupusas SF has to offer. So cheap and tasty a true SF treat that will fill ur savory tastes of authentic latino cuisine.
Great breakfast too. Delicious machaca and other savory egg dishes cooked from scratch a delightful hangover spot for sunday brunch or breakfast. Jose's attention to quality food and assurance makes for phenomenal mexican cuisine.
The countertop service adds to the old school setting of dining alone or w a friend but there is plenty of room in the restaurant for large parties or a family night out.
Experience this spot. No matter what u get. Most all of the time its going to be delicious!!!</text>

So I answered polity,, let me show you, I've found five chips that obviously are from a client before me, I mean, people comes with a dirty mouth grabs the chips bite and then they put the chip inside the sauce with saliva , that is gros the, the waitress affirmed saying but you don't have to do this, I am not giving you service again. I feel like vomiting by thinking I was eating someone's wasted food. Of course I am not coming back to that place I'm going to upload a picture of the waitress. And like I said I WILL call inspection to close that dirty restaurant.

I arrived at 11:30p for a  11:59 scheduled pick up.  I was told that I could take the trailer, but the paperwork was not printed and would not be until 0300 or 0400. I asked if I could hook up to the trailer and wait at the dock for the paperwork. That was approved by the entrance guard. At 0300, I was told 0500. At 0500, I was told that the guy was booting the system and will bring the paperwork to the truck. At 0600, the yard jockey offers to pull the trailer out and take it to the gate because he needed that door and they were still trying to locate the paperwork. Finally, at 0628, a lady comes to the truck and says sign here and here. While the guard at the exit gate was extremely nice and empathetic, the lack of organization and effective communication made this a poor experience.< /text>

< review>
Customer service is non existent here. Waited an hour when was specifically told it would be 30-40 mins to start on my vehicle. Wouldn't mind waiting but it took an hour. When asking how much longer it would be, front desk clerk gave attitude as if it's my fault she told me an incorrect time. Did not appreciate the attitude when asking a simple question. The older gentleman doing the actual work was apologetic and worked on not taking forever. He is appreciated. The lady should do better in responding to people when she is the one giving out information that I went off of. Would go back if I only dealt with the man.<//review>

Huge selection, incredible service. Matt is the most helpful person I have ever met. The store is huge! They have all kinds of things from building supplies to clothes and even a restaurant! <date>1615477466175< /date>< rate>
3<//rate>
< text>
Kelseyville lumber is hit or miss with the service. At the contractors desk there some employees who seem to play favorites when the place gets  busy leaving folks who may not have lived here forever to feel like the new kid in fourth grade. The guy that finally ,"helped ," me with my plumbing questions was no help at all. In fact he seemed annoyed to even have to have a dismissive interaction with me and assured me that he didn't know whom I should ask period . Not later in the afternoon or possibly another day and most certainly not at present and ,,,," Could you please let the next customer in line have his chance sir?!!"
To be fair there were more days when the service was very good . The staff was knowledgeable,  friendly and informative . But if you get the wrong people your out of luck.
Very expensive as well. Quality merchandise abounds but, for such an economically challenged area it would seem like they might want to cary some more moderately priced lines of tools instead of just high end goods. I have not memorized the inventory so perhaps my perception was just off. It sure seems like Mendo Mill is less pricey though.
I will say I really enjoy woodys dilooner. Great food!<//text>

<text>Wrong day to ask me about my experience at Kelseyville Lumber. Well actually it's not much different than almost every other time I try to buy something there. The unfortunate thing is they are so close and convenient, but it's just not worth how mad or upset I am by the time I leave. The incompetence of many of the employees, and the lack of desire to help is incredible. Common items not priced and check out personnel that can't find the price. Both caused by poor inventory control. No common
sense used by checkers. I 'tried' to buy an item that had an actual tag on it, and it was marked $1.10. The girl said the total was $1.53. I questioned it and she stated, "The register says $1.53". I replied that even with tax it couldn't be that price. She stated again,  "The register says $1.53. I walked out. This is only one small example of poor service by one of their employees. Don't get me started on how most of them avoid asking if you need any help or have any questions. I won't even go into why I walked out empty handed today. But it has to do with standing in a line of only 3 people for 15 minutes while the clerk tried to do a 50 cent return. I had $50 worth of plants in my cart. They're still there. I walked out.
I have been a patron of Kelseyville Lumber for over 20 years. It was not always like this. I simply don't understand.< /text>< user>

< review>
It's a nice store with lots of selection. While sometimes on the higher side in price they are not nearly as expensive at Mendo Mill (aka Bend over Mill). I find they are best for door and window selection and they do a fantastic job. Turnaround on special order items is reasonable and delivery fee is only $15 and usually can be delivered the next day.< /review>

< Text>
The stroll was worth the water scenery comparative between the bay and the open ocean. Be ready for a 20 minute walk. I enjoyed the unique concrete water breaks and the fog horn sound as I strolled. You also get a good view of the lighthouse during the journey to the end of the jetty.</Text>

< Review>
The Jetty is awesome and has a lot of historic information all around it. You might have to go anywhere to Crescent City to figure out why the cement structures are there and shape that way but it's worth the journey. I did not make it to the lighthouse because I do not allow dogs which I wish they told me that when I was out in the parking lot but I may have missed the sign. Didn't want to leave my dogs in the car on a hot day. But it was a awesome Journey walking around the area I come back every single time :-)<//Review>

<rate>5</rate>< Review>
I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves the sound of the ocean. The waves crashing against the jetty along with the sound of the seabirds is so relaxing. The fog rolls in so fast that the city disappears right before your eyes. It must be very popular with the locals. I could get use to taking early morning or evening walks with the puppies out here.< /Review>

<UserId.>103224972116564021962< /UserId.><user_name>Robert Stoddard< /user_name><date>1535921532216< /date>< rate>
5</rate>
< Review>
The walk down the Jerry to the ‚öì Anchor Graveyard was awesome. Got to see lots of wildlife :crabs, pelcians (most I have seen ) a black bird with a long orange beak (I do not know the name) Kill deer(Yes this is what the birds are called) Cranes and Blue Heron. Also, saw Harbor Seals ,squirrels and seagulls.
There's also a park area with picnic tables , beach access, and toilets. Beach area is Sandy and rocky is safe and clean for childern. Toilets are kept clean also.
Would recommend stopping here if your in the area.<//Review>

<Rate>2< /Rate>< Review>
It's an okay place to stop by. It's a run down town and the sewage place is near by the lighthouse, sending a smell that you don't want to remember every 5 seconds. The bathrooms by the beach is not clean at all. I only gave it a 2 star because of the lighthouse and because I witness a humpback whale that day. Oh,  there is a little carnival near by. I didn't check it out, but if you have kids or to have a good time, that could be place to stop by.< /Review>

I would absolutely use him again and the first person I would call for cleaning services.</Review>

< review>
This company was a rip-off.  Their housekeeper spent only two hours doing what they called a "deep-cleaning" charging me $140 for a poor cleaning job with a Swiffer.  This was a move-out assignment and the homeowner was so unhappy with all the things that were missed she charged me $200 to have a two person crew come and clean for 3 hours to fix what Wave Housekeeping missed. Also, their housekeeper showed up way too early for the appointment window, left to get her eyebrows done, and then didn't come back until AFTER the appointment arrival window had closed.  She also had an attitude like it was my fault she was not on time.  I informed Wave Housekeeping of the issues, pictures, video and even copies of call records and emails from the homeowner.  After weeks of this I was given only a %35 refund despite their %100 gaurantee.  UPDATE: A day after I posted this review they gave me a FULL refund and the matter has been resolved satisfactorily.  I hope that other people who use their service have a better experience than I did.<//review>

<Response>None</Response>< review>
Wave Cleaners are great. It's nice that it feels like a small operation, vs Handy that feels like a machine and the cleanings aren't as thorough. We have found a set of cleaners through Wave that we've requested to come back next time since they did such a good job (nice little touches like arranging the pillows and towels don't go unnoticed!). We originally had a woman coming independently to our house, but we moved across town and she couldn't come that far. So we started using Handy, but the service was impersonal and it didn't feel like the cleaners were personally invested in doing their best. We found Wave on Yelp and they've been great - quick responses and helpful. I hope their next step is to make an app or online appointment system to make it even easier. Very satisfied with this service and will continue to use. Thanks Wave!<//review>

<review>I've been using Wave for about 9 months now.  I live alone (with a big dog) in a moderately sized 2 bedroom apartment and I'm a very neat person, so I only have them come once a month to frankly do the things I don't want to do, like clean the showers and my stove.  They do a great job and the women who have come into my home couldn't have been nicer or more friendly to my dog (which is very important to me).

Speaking of showers, it's often the little things that define quality of service.  This week the woman who cleaned my place got my glass shower door cleaner than I've ever been able to get it.  It's long suffered from years and years of hard water and soap deposits.  Not even CLR could get it all clean.  But after this week's cleaning it is completely clear. I don't know what she used, but it was amazing.

It's also often how a company handles service issues that defines quality of service.  The one time I contacted the office about something the cleaner missed (a floor left wet after being cleaned), they got back to me almost immediately and offered to send someone to fix the situation right away.<//review>< gmap_id>

< user_id>
113558995600000717185</user_id>
< name>
Jamie Kidder< /name>
<time>1502218147712<//time><Rate>5< /Rate>< Review>
I've been wanting to have periodic maid service for some time, however, my significant other is not very trusting after she had some jewelry boosted by some movers.  I convinced her that we'd go with a company that is insured and I'd leave work early to be at the home while the cleaning occurred.  After scouring Yelp and Google reviews and their straight forward pricing, I decided to go with Wave House Cleaning.

Scheduling was a breeze.  I scheduled for a 3PM cleaning.  I got home at 2:45PM and the maid was already there!  I opened the door and the maid (Marisol?) got right to work, attacking the master bath first.  No easy task as my gf uses a number of hair/aerosol products that cause a layer of gunk to build up on the flat surfaces in the bathroom.  I spot checked and she got everything...very impressed!

The maid did my entire 2 bedroom/2 bath apartment in about 3 hours and 20 minutes.  This was their "deep clean" as required for the 1st cleaning.

My apartment is all hardwood floors with area rugs.  Not sure I would have been impressed with the vacuum the maid brought if I had more carpeting but was sufficient for my apartment's needs.

The customer service was great.  I got a call the morning of the cleaning to confirm and had all my questions answered.  I definitely plan on using them again before my parents visit in mid-September.<//Review>

Ayres Hotel Manhattan beach. This is my little secret get away. Ayres hotel Manhattan Beach is one of the properties of the Ayres Hotels. However, this property in Manhattan Beach is very very special and unique set apart from all the other Ayres Hotels in Southern California

As soon as you walked into the hotel lobby you will never forget that the stunning grand stairs case and the huge tapestry wall hanging behind the front desk. The hotel have the old chateau feel, from the painting to the grand fireplace in the lobby, all the antiques craved wood furnitures, you almost forgot you  are in Manhattan Beach, California.

The staffs are very lovely and wonderful, they would try their best to accommodate your needs and request to make your stay unforgettable.

The rooms are very spacious, the executive suite are even bigger with separate living room and bed room. My personal favorite executive suite is room 413 it‚Äôs on the top floor and at the corner with very high ceiling.
However, all the rooms that facing the courtyard are wonderful.

The hotel located off the 405 freeway so it‚Äôs very convenience.

Top it all, I was very surprised the rate of this luxury hotel is very affordable. That‚Äôs a Plus +
It make you feel good about the money you spent is totally worth it !

So if you ever travel to Southern California and the beach Cities you should defiantly check this hotel out and see if you agreed.

It‚Äôs definitely

<date>1620457032373</date>< Text>
We booked this hotel through Hotels.com as it was conveniently located near the Airport and Manhattan Beach.

Our initial reception was fantastic - friendly check in representative who was welcoming and helpful.  The list of positives ends there.

When we got to the room (room 405) we discovered blood stains on bed sheets, comforter, and towels.  Not just one stain, multiple stains in multiple places (sheets, comforter, bath towels).  Talk about making your skin crawl. Of course our initial inclination was that the room had not been cleaned or sanitized, and we are in the middle of a freaking pandemic.

We immediately went downstairs and  asked another front desk representative to send housekeeping to change all the linens (sheets, comforter, bath towels) while we were at dinner.

We also asked to speak to the manager, he was no where to be found, but we were advised that he (Jairo) would call us to discuss the problem.

Needless to say, Jairo never called.

Upon our late return from dinner, we found the room exactly how we had found it earlier, blood stains on all the linens.

We went down to inform another front desk representative to let them know, at 12:45am, to be told that housekeeping has left for the day and that they didn't have anyone to change the sheets.

The midnight desk clerk again vehemently denied that blood stains on the linens were possible until I showed him the photos. After showing him photo after photo he agreed to change our room to room 454.  And again he promised that one of the mangers Jairo, or Jack Ellis, would contact us immediately in the morning.

Again, no manager reached out to us.

Room 454 looked fine, however just being on the same floor as the bloody room left me feeling uneasy and nauseous all night.

Next day, we informed the check out clerk of the same issue, asking to talk to a manager, to be told that there is no manager on duty.  She mentioned again that Jack Ellis is the one to speak with, she said he is the front desk manager, and would give us a call to remedy the situation but we haven't received the call yet.

This hotel make no attempts at customer service.

I realize that doing business during a pandemic is difficult, but the management at this hotel should be on premises to deal with customers concerns and complaints.  This is truly an unacceptable way to do business, or to treat your clientele.< /Text>

<Date>1616780325618<//Date><rate>5< /rate>< Review>
I had a wonderful stay. I wish I could've stayed longer. The hotel is beautiful and well appointed. Parking is complimentary due to the pandemic, which was nice. The only thing is you have to insert the room key into the parking reader a couple of times before it reads it to open the lift gate, but nothing more serious than that. The room is beautiful and so comfortable. I would suggest they upgrade their t.v. system to larger t.v.'s (they only have 32 inches), and the ability to connect to streaming services like some other, more modern hotels. The front desk was so friendly and helpful. They offered the ice bucket at the front desk and I was able to call down and ask them to bring up a bottle corkscrew. Otherwise, it was a wonderful stay and I would absolutely stay here again.< /Review>

< Review>
I don't often leave reviews but our experience with this hotel was majorly disappointing. The room itself was fine. Customer service was terrible. We stayed one night and in the morning found our car had been hit while parked in their (nearly empty) lot. Luckily we were within sight of their security cameras, but hotel staff was not willing to give us the footage, review it themselves, or provide it to police or insurance - they pretty much just told us it was our problem to deal with and sent us on our way without trying to help in any way. Not what we expected from a "luxe" hotel. Disappointed and we will never be staying here again.</Review>

< Review>
Love it... I've been wanting to stay here for a while. I check it out every time I go to Costcoüòä and I wasn't disappointed. Sadly I didn't get a chance to take some pictures But the room was very nice, spacious and cozy. There's a cute half wall with wooden shutters separating the King bed area equipped with the basics.... two end tables, lamps, writing desk and chair, from a sitting area with a couch, coffee table, small round dining table with two chairs. An armoire with the TV. The cabinet with mini fridge, microwave and coffee pot is right there when you first walk in the door and spacious bath next to that.  Price was good. $98 + tax. It's right across the way from Costco, McDonald's and several other places in the shopping center. Conveniently accessible off the 405 FWY.  I will definitely be back for hopefully a #Staycation for several days. With pics to match ‚ò∫Ô∏è</Review>

<rate>5<//rate>< Review>
Since we discovered the Ayres hotels in 2020 my fiance and I have been huge fans. When covid hit last spring, my fiance and I were getting ready to move into an apartment but the entire state of California shut down and we were forced to stay in a hotel for several months. We were obviously disappointed but there was 1 very big silver lining. We discovered the Ayres hotels! We spent 2 months at the ayres location in Mission Viejo which as amazing! So when we were needing a hotel close to LAX, we found an Ayres hotel in Manhattan Beach. Not only was the hotel close to the airport but the quality of the hotel was top notch! The rooms are spacious, the bed was so comfortable. The staff was incredible, they really went the extra mile to make sure our stay was pleasurable and relaxing. The hotel is beautiful inside and out with an immaculate swimming pool and spa. They offer a gym with everything you need to get in a good workout and when your done, they provide a complimentary shuttle to and from the beach. With as much as my fiance and I travel, its really nice knowing that whichever Ayres Hotel we  stay at, our stay will be amazing!<//Review>

< text>
I've stayed here before and enjoyed their Victorian accommodations but this time was just ok. They are doing renovations and really should have the 3rd floor closed off right now because it simply looks a hot mess and you must walk through this right off the elevator to get to your room. < Date>

<Pictures>None< /Pictures><text>Checked-into this hotel with the intention of using their pool, jacuzzi, and loved that it was central to the Manhattan Beach business district plus the beach. I needed to get away from my native San Francisco due to the quarantine mandates, plus it was central to LA so I was close enough to visit family. It seemed like a great idea and location. It was just me, late 20's female. Needless to say, the hotel itself looks great but their management was terrible. Not to mention the folk that frequent the hotel had more of a motel vibe than anything else. There were families that were extremely loud down some of the corridors, where in others it seemed like a brothel, if you know what I mean. Beware of shifty people that roam the property.  This was not the peaceful stay I was hoping for. They also shut down the pool and jacuzzi without letting anyone know. On my last day someone pulled the fire alarm. At check-in I was told that I could not stay at my original booked room due to "unexpected" construction. On my last day, I asked to speak to a manager where I was informed he had stepped-out and would call me back, never happened. They had the decency of comping me a mere $50. If you want a motel vibe stay here. The remodeling and look of the place is very deceptive. Not at all a boutique hotel. If you're looking for an affordable spot close to the business district, beware of the horrible management, unexpected changes, plus how loud it is. Personally, very disappointed.<//text>< gmapID>

< username>

<date>1606279089342</date><Rating>5< /Rating>< text>
I am so glad I decided to stay at Ayres for the 4 nights while visiting family in the South Bay! I was greeted/checked-in by Anaid, who was friendly and professional. I was pleasantly surprised to find out I didn't have to pay $15 parking per day, and she gave us a fun fact sheet about the beautiful pieces throughout the hotel. I especially loved the peace and quiet there. The entire staff were welcoming and the service was excellent! There's a beautiful courtyard area, a pool and jacuzzi (that weren't crowded,) making it easy to enjoy. The room was equipped with free WiFi, fridge and microwave which came in handy, especially since covid, we could bring food back to the room and "social distance" instead of eating at a restaurant. Overall the hotel gets a high score from me and I will definitely return when in Los Angeles!< /text>

<user_id>104585437727072347436< /user_id><name>Tara Rogers<//name><Date>1618849170148<//Date>< rating>
5</rating>
< Review>
What a beautiful place to stay!<//Review>
<Pics>None< /Pics><Resp>None< /Resp><gmapID>0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa</gmapID></record></dataset><record>
< user_name>
Joe Parsons< /user_name>
<Response>None</Response><rate>4</rate>< user_id>
111569035346011118684</user_id>
<date>1582415525899</date>< Pictures>
None< /Pictures>
< text>
The room was excellent, as was the overall "vibe of the hotel. The one minor quibble I'd offer is that the restaurant--which feels like a very nice high-end establishment--is not up to the obvious high standards of the hotel.

In particular, the quality of the breakfast experience was not what I would have expected. On Friday morning, when my two companions and I sat down in a nearly empty restaurant, the service was quite, shall we say, leisurely. We had to ask for coffee, and when my eggs arrived, they were overcooked and my order was not correct. Speaking as someone who has owned restaurants in the past, I know that properly cooking a breakfast order--especially eggs--requires a certain skill and finess. The eggs were over-cooked at too high a temperature so that the edges were browned. They were edible, but not of the quality I would have expected. I received one slice of lightly toasted dry sourdough (butter was in wrapped packets on the table) and no jelly.

The orders for the three of us arrived at the table at different times. This was similar to our service experience at dinner the night before--we all had the same entree, but they arrived at different times.

None of of these are deal-killers, but the rest of your establishment is so nice that I would have expected food service to be at the same level of quality.

Joe Parsons<//text>

< Text>
I made my reservation just one day before arrival. I appreciated the fact that  the central res team I spoke with was based in FL and the agent spoke English. The agent was excellent to work with. When I arrived on site, Natale at the front desk remembered me from my April stay and was very welcoming.. I have been staying at this property since 2008.  I loved my room ( 372) and the fact I can open the window for fresh air. Parking is easy and the location is great. This was my 3rd stay in 2019. I ordered room service breakfast and it was delivered  hot and timely. I called the hotel after I checked out, I think i forgot my bathing suit in the room. any help you can provide is appreciated. Thank you.</Text>

<name>REGINA T< /name><Date>1556837521080< /Date><Rate>4< /Rate><review>If you are in Los Angeles and want to do the beach circuit, stay at the Ayres Hotel in Manhattan Beach. It looks much better on the inside than the outside. I hate that they put a gate in the parking area because it's too close to the street and causes congestion. The hotel is conveniently located off the 405 and 10 mins to the beach. Plus, Costco is directly across the street as well as other places to buy food. I've stayed here 6 years ago and the quality and service are still the same.

I would encourage people to sit and enjoy the courtyard and lobby area. It transports you back to old world Europe. The rooms have a microwave, mini fridge and plenty of counter space.

Stayed here one night for my birthday. Will come back again because it's like 10 mins from LAX. Loved the convenience.</review><pictures>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipM2_qcK6rm7i-GKxCctYYTGmvUK5pTGSmGJdPFR=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNckWfntk1WnfY_GyhcKO06dFHD84a-Gt2k0XE-=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipMhHzC3r2gJMVWYWMcdMdvEatS6rX8kl8oEfBkR=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNBn5GvFaa7nj3UOACJS6y0znzbkv0giKfkXIQS=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]</pictures><response>None< /response>< gmap_id>

<user_id>103318588015110398737< /user_id><name>Chris Pope< /name>< date>
1567093480223<//date>
<Rating>5<//Rating><review>What a beautiful place!  As you enter the Ayres Manhattan Beach Hotel, you see this grand, sweeping imperial staircase in the lobby.  The decor has a wonderful Old World European flair ‚Äì a large tapestry behind the lobby desk, high ceilings, handcrafted dark wood furniture, beautiful paintings and an inviting fireplace.
When I checked in, I was greeted by a friendly clerk. She explained the dual use of the card key: one, for room entry and two, a means to turn on the lights.  As I walked down the hall to my room, I was impressed by the historical framed photographs of Frank Ayres and the early days of land development in Los Angeles.  My room was quite spacious, beautifully furnished and quite comfortable.
Breakfast at the Matisse restaurant in the hotel is reasonably priced and quite good. Like the hotel, the restaurant reminds you of a European restaurant ‚Äì beautiful paintings, white tablecloths and peaceful atmosphere.
I do recommend the Ayres Hotel as a great place to stay.  The atmosphere is one of warmth, elegance and comfort.  For me it was such a pleasant change from the more modern furnished hotels I‚Äôve stayed in.</review>< Pictures>
None< /Pictures>

<Date>1591376973543<//Date>< rating>
5< /rating>
<Text>Left today after a week of staying for covid exposure. (Was covid neg yay). They had rules already set for us, made evident on the day of arrival. All front desk and housekeeping wearing masks appropriately. It was nice knowing Ayres Hotel supports front line workers who have family at home they want to protect. I was able to get a hotel the day I found out about the exposure, which is superb service! There is a refrigerator and microwave so I brought all my food for the week and stayed in my room. Going to common areas is forbidden, for obvious reasons (though the lobby and outside courtyard are sooo elegant and cute). All you have to do at the end of your stay is collect all your dirty linens and throw it into a large trashbag and another trashbag for throwing out all your trash. Best way to keep housekeeping from getting exposed. Very very happy with my stay. Will come back after covid is over.</Text>< Pictures>
None</Pictures>

< Text>
We spend two nights at this location and it was very enjoyable.  The decor is very European.  The building is clean, updated and has a very nice pool with cool seating outside, (which I did not use, just an observation).  The receptionist was quick at check-in and very informative.

You have to use your room keys to turn on the lights, which is an energy saving feature.  What a great way to save on energy.

The location what great for us, next to 405 freeway with Costco has right next door.  There's a Porsche dealer next door as well if you want to upgrade your ride üòâ.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay and I highly recommend it.  Our weekend plans changed and we ended up doing Disneyland.  The commute was about 20 minutes, but because we left early and arrived late, no traffic was really encountered.<//Text>

Unlike a chain hotel, this feels more like having a room in an old mansion and everyone is waiting to gather in the parlor to play a murder mystery game. The lobby is cozy with its fireplace that feels so good when it's cold outside. Only negative is the difficulty in finding one's way to the elevator after leaving the room to go downstairs. < review>
It tries to be fancy, but it's just a normal hotel with a weird aesthetic and some very poorly designed features.

They have a power saving thing that you're supposed to put your room card into to turn on all the lights. The person I was staying with took his with him while I was in the shower... leaving me in total darkness. There's also omnipresent "classical" music playing on the first floor.

They also require you to use your room card to enter and exit the parking lot. The readers are poorly placed and usually require you to get out of your car. The entrances are on a busy street, so it's dangerous. Ever heard of parking passes and a towing service? I guess this place hasn't.<//review>

<username>bill Wright</username>< Time>
1581841319078<//Time>
< rating>
1<//rating>
< Review>
This place is probably ome of the worst I have stayed at when it comes to customer service.  To start the $15 parking fee is nothing but a cash grab.  I have stayed in hotels in major cities where parking is a premium or the garage is shared and the parking fee makes sense.  But when a property is in the outskirts, has a massive parking lot and is adjoined by a mall parking lot with THOUSANDS of spots...the fee is just that... a cash grab.   As pretty as the hotel is, they couldn't spend the extra few dollars on a control system that allows the lights to be illuminated upon entry or by occupancy.  Sonyou have to leave a key in a slot for thenlights to even work and then naturally you leave it in the room causing an inconvenience.  Asking firba late check out was apparently a tall order as i was told to call in the morning and ask when we needed to plan out our day the night before.  So as I said...not customer focused and therefore reaps a poor review.  We will not return.< /Review>

None</pictures>

< Text>
This is the very best place to stay when in LA, for a number of reasons.

1. Very close proximity to the airport, without the noise.
2.THE best and most comfy pillows and beds I've found in a hotel.
3. Beautiful surroundings. Makes one feel like you're living in a castle!
4. The restaurant attached to the hotel is excellent both in service and food. You don't need to drive in traffic to get a great dining experience.
5. Rooms are lovely, quiet, and equipped with a refrigerator and nice, separate, bathroom area.

In all, an excellent experience and the only place I'll stay when traveling to LA on business or pleasure.
Thank you!

<UserId.>116742222971985616602</UserId.><rating>5</rating>< Date>
1502400561724</Date>
<Review>The hotel is a beautiful property located conveniently close to the freeway.  Room was nicely appointed with a good bed and very high ceilings giving a feeling of spaciousness.  The hotel lacks the included breakfast and free happy hour that some of the Ayres properties offer, which is unfortunate, but there is an on-site restaurant.  I enjoyed a cocktail and tasty snack at the bar upon arrival, reasonably priced, served by a pleasant bartender.  The modest charge for parking is understandable given the location, however the equipment needs some repair - the Hindry Avenue gate to the northern parking lot would never open with the use of the parking pass, and it was necessary to pull a ticket each time to get in.  More importantly, the parking pass worked fine to actuate the gate when exiting the property, so it wasn't really a big deal..< /Review></record>

<time>1547443980255<//time><rate>5<//rate><text>This gem is frequented by locals and airline crews. It's it right next to the 405 freeway and can be a little tricky to get into but once you do get in it's easy there on out. The property is gorgeous. The decor is romantic Italian luxury featuring marble floors, crystal chandeliers, a grand wrap staircase, lovely sculptures and magohogony armoires and furnishings. Perfect for a wedding. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and shopping within walking distance. There is a small swimming pool and iron tables and chairs on the outside patio in the center of the hotel. The rooms are very large with many amenities. The whole place is clean and reasonably priced. The staff is professional, and quick to get the job done. We hosted an event in the Florentine room and had our staff stay at the hotel and look forward to doing so again next year.</text>< pictures>

< review>
I had a lovely stay here! The rooms are cozy with extremely comfortable mattresses (very important!) and everything was clean and tidy.

The grand foyer is exatly that... GRAND. It has a majestic staircase that is the perfect backdrop for photo opportunities. There is carefully curated artwork all throughout the hotel and the interior architectural details are noteworthy as well.

Every staff member was extremely pleasant and oh!! - the onsite restaurant was absolutely delicious! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay! It's minutes from the beach and has lots of shopping and dining nearby and is close to major highways as well. I reccomend!<//review>

<user_name>Darrien Boling<//user_name><Pictures>None</Pictures><Rating>4<//Rating>< GmapID>
0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa<//GmapID>
<user_id>114670773567409363259< /user_id><date>1531794921496< /date><Response>{'time': 1532121653594, 'text': "Dear Darrien Boling, Thank you for taking the time to share your candid review! We genuinely appreciate you sharing your feedback regarding our room accommodations. This will be addressed to our team members and we will make the changes that are needed in order to create a more warm and welcoming stay for all of our valued guests. Nothing is more important to us than our guest's experience. Nevertheless, we are very happy to see that you had a very enjoyable time while staying with us. Your recommendations and compliments about our team members and hotel are very generous of you. We thank again and we look forward to having you back for another wonderful time! Sincerely, Dave Lagarce General Manager"}< /Response>< Review>
The Ayres Manhattan Beach was a very nice looking hotel. The entryway and lobby are tastefully decorated in Victorian style. You'll want to take pictures. Although Victorian is their theme, the hotel could stand some modernization. The appliances and TV are dated, and the shower has an incredibly impractical shower head that ends up getting the bathroom floor wet. That being said, the staff are friendly, and the pool is nice, if a bit small. Beautiful chandeliers on the interior along beautiful banquet rooms make me feel this would be a great wedding venue. In our particular room the sink countertop was clearly broken at some point and poorly put back together, but fully functional. The windows don't have full privacy, because only the slightly transparent curtains pull fully shut. The lot behind our room was private with thick hedges, but fully closing curtains would still be nice. Parking is easy and only $10/night, which is a steal for the area. Rooms were very spacious, clean, and the furniture was high quality. The mattress was super comfortable. It was also very quiet; no noise could be heard in the hallway or other rooms. All-in-all, it's a nice hotel that needs a few updates to be truly great, but for the price, I feel it was a good value.</Review>

<text>This place was a treasured find.  A friend was getting married, and the reception was here.  We decided to come early and stay four nights total, and I am so glad we did.  They shuttle to the beach, the restaurant on site was good for all meals (we went a few times during our stay), and the rooms were gorgeous!  We arrived very early, and even though we were supposed to check in at 3 they let us check in at 11:30 when they had a room available.  After waking up at 3am Pacific time, that was very much appreciated.  At the end of our stay, we left our electronics bag there when leaving for the airport, and they had it packaged up and sent to us very quickly.  Nothing like leaving in an Uber at 4:30 am only to realize your tablet, keyboard, mouse, and countless charger cables were all left in the hotel lobby.  It was a huge relief when they found it, and let us know it was no problem to mail it to us.  Lori helped us through it all, along with others on staff.  All were very professional and helpful. <Response>None< /Response>< review>
A decent hotel, with mostly large, airy rooms. Windows open, at least a bit. Some top floor rooms are noisy due to mechanical equipment on the roof. Courtyard facing rooms may be noisy if they have an event going on, or if there are noisy kids in the pool. Highway facing rooms are not suitable if you want to have a window open, they are ok with air conditioning on.<//review>

<response>{'time': 1553613340917, 'text': 'Dear Christy Lamb, Thank you for your generous review! We look forward to seeing you back soon to enjoy our beautiful hotel. Sincerely, Dave Lagarce General Manager'}< /response><Time>1553007717973< /Time><name>Charming Pony Ranch Parties<//name><gmap_id>0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa<//gmap_id></record></dataset><record>
< user>
104012530696262734750< /user>
< name>
Kiky Roquemore< /name>
<Time>1565660266944</Time><rate>1<//rate>< text>
THIS IS A LONG ONE... BRACE YOURSELVES.
My husband and I decided to celebrate our WEDDING anniversary at the Matisse Restaurant, inside of the Ayres hotel. We had a few family members join us (we did not want to do anything too extravagant) for the evening. Upon arrival, the vibe was a bit callous (RED FLAG #1), however, I did not want to jump to any conclusions regarding my opinion of the place (and it was too late to go anywhere else) so we stayed to try and enjoy our evening. After ordering and eating our food, I found that it was not spectacular (could have been better for the price), but not too bad. The service was so-so (although the waiter was friendly so I am not including him in this bad rating). After being there a couple hours, we were done and gearing up to pay the tab. As we waited for the check, there was one incident where, the host made it her point to single out, speak to, and play with ONE CHILD in particular. While ignoring the other FOUR children who were in attendance. The first time she did it, I did not say anything, but after she came back 3 times to address the same child (the lightest child at the table). I had to bring it to her attention that, the other children even tried to speak to her and she ignored them yet she continues to play with and compliment this ONE. Even after I brought this it to her attention; instead of addressing the other children, she still ignored them and said "Oh... I didn't see them" then she added insult to injury by going back to the mixed-race child and offering him a dessert (and we had a cake!). She did not offer any of the other children anything. That was RED FLAG #2.
Then my niece had to use the restroom so my sister went to ask the front desk clerk (of the hotel) where the restrooms were... the clerk frowned at her and SNARLED "it's over there" while pointing in the distance to a long hall. My sister did not say anything, she just came back into the restaurant to tell me what happened. The Chicano waiter who then informed us where is was. The host then stated "there is no way to find the restroom without someone showing you were to go". I then informed her of how the front-desk clerk behaved and how she basically shooed my sister and niece off and she stated that she would "do something about it". After we finished, everyone moved towards the lobby. As we were leaving, there was a group of teenagers who were coming into the lobby from outside, they were loud and playing around and no one blinked an eye. My 4 year old niece, 10 year old niece and 9 year old nephew were telling jokes and laughing as they waited for everyone to gather in the lobby. The same clerk who snarled at my sister, called security on them. As I walked into the lobby, I saw her roll her eyes, heard her exhale as if she was annoyed, and saw her stare angrily at these CHILDREN as she picked up a two-way radio and called the security (or her manager). The manager came out of the back room and appeared to tell her, he was not going to do anything because they were children and they were not doing anything wrong. At this point, I was appalled and insulted. I went to inform the host (because I was told she was the manager over the hotel/restaurant staff). She informed me that she had nothing to do with the front desk and that she would introduce me to the supervisor and he could handle the complaint. I went to put my things inside of the car and to take the children out of the lobby. Upon my return, I noticed that the angry clerk was ducking off to the back and the supervisor was now tending to the front desk. I asked for the name of the angry clerk and they would not give it to me. I was told that they would "take care of the situation", but I think they did nothing. This is the treatment my family and I received, on my anniversary, after spending a pretty penny with this establishment. I am disappointed and will not be returning to this place. I will also advise anyone not to come here. Save your time, money, and feelings and go some place where they APPRECIATE ALL of their CUSTOMERS.< /text>

I did not find the room to be very good. I was on the first floor, and did not realize until after I had gone to bed that the window was actually a sliding glass door, and also that the door was unlocked! I felt very uncomfortable with that, thinking that someone could have easily walked in. Next, the bath towels all had other people's hairs in them. All three of my towels! It was clear they had been washed, dried and folded, but the hairs were all intertwined in the towels. And it was clearly not just one person's hair but multiple, different people. It was just unappealing. Finally, the doors/walls were very thin and a lot of sound came from the bathroom area. It made me feel like someone was possibly in the room (given that the sliding door was unlocked for a few hours before I noticed it was a door!) Needless to say, I think I only got 1 hour of sleep. I was not pleased.</review>

<UserId.>112396527708894101704</UserId.><name>Chris Lewis</name>< Time>

<Rate>5< /Rate>< text>
It's my first time staying at the Ayres Hotel. I was given a room on the first floor which turns out it pretty cool. The ceilings in the room are 18 feet high with hanging lights. I was very impressed with the decor and ambiance. The price is very competitive and I think is a great value for the room. Doesn't have a continental breakfast, but it does have a nice restaurant and bar. The pool area and courtyard are also very nice. The convenient location to LAX made it very desirable for me. Check-in was a breeze and house keeping has kept my room in perfect order. I would definitely stay here again! Food and shopping is also within walking distance. If you want more options, just catch an Uber or Lyft to just about anything you can think of near by.< /text>

<rating>4<//rating><Review>My family stayed here during our time of mourning after losing my aunt. We needed someplace near all the services to be together and I am very glad we selected the Ayres hotel.

Only snafu happened upon check-in for my mom and sister, as my fiance and I were paying for both rooms and the person at the front desk at the time told them that wasn't allowed. After getting a manager involved, we were able to move beyond and my mom and sister were able to check in.

Once we arrived, we were very impressed with the lobby and design of the interior. Simply gorgeous!

Our room was big and the bed was cozy.

The parking lot is an absolute mess with the system in place, but we managed to navigate anyway.

Overall, this is a gorgeous hotel with courteous staff on duty who greeted us every time we'd come back into the hotel.</Review><pics>None</pics>< Response>
None<//Response>

< GmapID>
0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa<//GmapID>
< review>
Most all was really great - loved the room and the hotel itself.  A couple of issues which prevents me from a perfect score on our stay. Room and hotel very nice, love the courtyard, and the library area especially, and the hotel was quiet and peaceful.  Parking was a good value at $10/day knowing I had a place to park and lot was somewhat secured was great.  The card system getting out of the lot was not good, I had to get out of the car each time and insert the card to exit for some reason.  Staff were courteous and professional however housekeeping missed our room one day even though we were out all day, and I another day they didn't replenish some of the supplies.  I asked the front desk to provide the supplies and they said they would  but we didn't get the needed supplies.  Pool is small. The courtyard was marvelous and we enjoyed sitting outside in peace and quiet.  Beds comfortable, liked the decor in the room and throughout the hotel.  The restaurant - Matisse - was excellent - a bit pricey for dinner, but great for breakfast.  The restaurant staff were great and made us feel like we were VIPs.  Overall I would highly recommend this hotel as the minor issues we had are tweaks that can be made in your operations.  We would certainly consider this hotel again in a future stay, along with the Hotel Hermosa which we also considered before choosing the Ayres.  This was a 40th anniversary vacation so we appreciate the stay experience at the Ayres.< /review>

<review>For the last 10 years I have stayed numerous times in Ayres hotels with pleasant experiences. I have also recommended the hotel to many of my friends and family.
This time I invited my extended family to stay with us in Ayres hotel. We arrived on Saturday August 13 and checked out on Tuesday August 16. Our room numbers were 307 and 331. Just a Few hours after we left the hotel  on our way home we noticed 2 Ipads(from room#331)  and an SLR camera (from room 307)were missing from their cases.
I called the hotel right away and asked them to check with housekeeping. Nobody seemed to be in charge and  I could not get any straight answer from security staff or the management. After several calls and three hours later I got a call from hotel that they could not find the items in the hotel.
This was the first time that my belongings were stolen in hotel rooms. The experience ruined an otherwise enjoyable vacation.
The fact that these items were taken from their cases in two different rooms is indicative of foul play in your premises.
I am totally disappointed with the experience and replacing the stolen camera and 2 Ipads have cost me over $2500.00.<//review>< rating>
1</rating>

106963370091621000525< /user>
<name>Michael Holman< /name>< date>
1445986723091</date>
<Rate>4<//Rate>< Review>
The facilities are beautiful and clean. The staff was very courteous and willing to help. The biggest drawbacks are 1) the workout facility gets too hot in the morning with the sun pouring in. 2) the breakfast options are nice, but not great (why have a quesadilla without salsa?); especially for the price. 3) Location... although it is a good spot for travelers to LAX, I try to avoid Los Angeles like the plague (so I unfortunately don't see myself returning for that reason alone; but if you build elsewhere, I would look you up). Also, getting in and out of the parking lot can be difficult with traffic; especially if you are not wanting to turn right. 4)  Keep working on the parking lot gates to make sure they work well.</Review>

<Review>Very beautiful hotel, felt more like a B&B.  The courtyard made us feel like we weren't even near a big city.
Staff pleasant and very nice.
Only thing I would say is our reservation called for (3) Adults, yet there weren't enough towels, cups and condiments for coffee.  The sofa bed was not made even folded in made, this was not a problem because I asked the staff to please have it made as we were going out.
One of the light-bulbs was flashing and I kept forgetting to let the front desk know until we checked out.  With such a lovely hotel these little items aren't much to talk about but it is the little touches that separate this type of Hotel from the Motel 6's.
Wish they had airport shuttle service.
Overall the hotel was absolutely wonderful and yes I would stay there or at another Ayers property.< /Review><Pictures>None< /Pictures>< response>

<userid>110075308903848776335</userid>< username>
Philip Davis< /username>
<time>1533711103630</time><rate>5</rate><Text>We were a party of four, staying at the hotel for two nights, predominately so we could attend a ELO concert at the Forum in Inglewood on Saturday night. We flew in from Sydney Australia on the Friday and flew home again on Sunday evening.

I booked two rooms at the hotel because of my excellent experience at another Ayres property in Anaheim around five years ago and because of its proximity to the concert venue.

We were not disappointed and I would recommend this hotel above all the others I have stayed at, in the LAX and Manhattan Beach areas.

The staff are professional, accommodating and look after their guests. The hotel itself is beautifully presented and the meals we ate there were lovely. The beds are incredibly comfortable and we found the hotel to be quiet.

There are a number of chain restaurants in the area, a Costco and good access to LA's freeways. Its a short drive or Uber to the close by communities, at Manhattan, Hermosa and Redondo beaches, where you can swim, ride a bike along the foreshore and take your pick from umpteen other restaurants. The hotel also runs a shuttle to Manhattan Beach.

Do yourself a favor and stay here, we enjoyed our stay very much and left with such a positive impression of the hotel and its staff.< /Text><pics>None<//pics>< Resp>
None<//Resp>
< GmapID>
0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa<//GmapID>
</record></dataset><record>

The hotel and stay were very nice but was not thrilled with the parking situation.  The parking is $10.00 per day but they don't tell you until you check in. <Name>Diane Dickinson<//Name><GmapID>0x80c2b417a15779c7:0xd18227ecdffd65aa< /GmapID>< Time>
1437156878272<//Time>
<Rating>2< /Rating><pictures>None<//pictures>< text>
We stayed here a few years ago for a family reunion and it was wonderful! So for a family vacation for 5 days we decided to return. Well, this time, not as great. No free breakfast anymore and $10 to park with annoying gates that rarely worked, much less  if you could even pull close enough to insert the key card. I could understand the parking fee if you were boxed in by other businesses that used your parking lot. But I don't think you have overflow parking being on a corner, car dealership nearby and a gas station on the other corner. Parking was never an issue in the past nor was it this visit so the parking fee in my opinion is just like the airlines anymore, just one more way to price gouge a traveler. The view we had was horrible, granted the homeless tent on the other side of the fence isn't your property or your problem, but when paying $1047 for 5 days, it is my problem when I have to keep the drapes closed to avoid looking at it. The shower situation is ridiculous too. I normally take a shower in under 7 minutes. I don't think a shower that barely spits water out is saving any water when you have to stay in there over 20 minutes to wash oneself and get the shampoo and then conditioner out of your hair.  On the up side, you do have a very friendly staff, clean rooms and no complaints with housekeeping. This particular property I would not recommend to any of my family again, and for that I'm sad to say because we all enjoyed it so much before.</text>

< Review>
Needed to fly out of LAX and Ayres is close to airport and had one of the best ratings in the area.  I booked through the hotel website, at least I thought I did, turns out due to some sort of glitch or error in the system I ended up booking through a 3rd party, which instead of booking me at Ayres booked me at another hotel. When I called to confirm my reservations, I was told that I had none. Luckily, the hotel manager, Ean, was able to fix the situation, though for a moment he instructed me to stay at the other hotel since the 3rd party was being difficult.  I told him that staying elsewhere would not be acceptable given that this booking fiasco was not my fault. Ean then assured me that he would honor my reservation at the price I paid and took care of the matter. However, I still had to call the 3rd party booking service and confirm my cancellation. I would have been extremely pleased if Ean had taken care of the entire situation and not wavered.  Nonetheless, I had a pleasant stay, but I hope no one else has to go through this confusion in the future. All I can suggest is that you confirm your reservations prior to arriving at the hotel.<//Review>

< user_name>
Dave Aronson</user_name>
< Date>
1437684264147<//Date>
<rate>5</rate><Text>Overall excellent.  Clean, quiet, comfortable, not too expensive.  Located within walking distance of good facilities of assorted kinds, like restaurants, Starbucks, Staples, Costco (I hear the hotel will lend you a membership card), etc.  Very nice lobby area for sitting around in and chatting.  Surprisingly stable and fast WiFi.  Good restaurant, with a good variety of food, some rather interesting (especially the dinner "share plates"), and not *too* expensive.

The only thing I would ding them on that is under their control is that it seems like nobody reads the email.  If you register online, you get an email saying to reply to it if you have any questions or concerns or changes, but if you do, nobody replies.  I had asked a couple days in advance about transportation from the airport and tried to arrange early checkin... twice... nada.

The other downside, that's *not* their fault, is apparently a problem with the LA area in general.  If want to go anywhere not in walking distance and you don't have a car, you're screwed, because the public transit is horrible.  If you DO have a car, you're *still* screwed, because everybody and their dog are also driving and clogging up the roads!  The solution we found for this is Uber, which we really like.  (Except some of their political stands, but that's another review.)  However, if you're going to go more than a few trips or about 50 miles per day, strongly consider renting a car.  Just be aware that the hotel will also make you pay for parking, and their gate system to get in and out seems like a pain.</Text><Pictures>None</Pictures>< Resp>
None</Resp>

(Translated by Google) The hotel is well located near Manhattan Beach, about 15 minutes by car without traffic and the area is not as ugly as the one near the airport.

We had problems: the first day, we checked early but there was no room, we consigned the suitcase and when we arrived at night we did not have a room, after 45 minutes of waiting they gave us one below what we contracted and the next day they promised us move to a suite, but it was not.

The last day, after arriving at night, they had not made the room and after protesting twice, they made the bed.

As compensation, they have discounted the price of one night. Therefore, bittersweet taste, the hotel is fine and spacious, but maybe we were unlucky.

(Original)
El hotel esta bien localizado cerca de Manhattan Beach, en coche como a 15 minutos sin trafico y la zona no es tan fea como la cercana al aeropuerto.

Hemos tenido problemas: el primer dia, hicimos checking temprano pero no habia habitacion, consignamos la maleta y al llegar a la noche no teniamos habitacion, despues de 45 minutos de espera nos dieron una por debajo de lo que contratamos y al siguiente dia nos prometieron cambiarnos a una suite, pero no fue asi.

El ultimo dia, tras llegar en la noche, no habian hecho el cuarto y despues de protestar dos veces, hicieron la cama.

Como compensaci√≥n, nos han descontado el precio de una noche. Por tanto, sabor agridulce, el hotel esta bien y es espacioso, pero tal vez tuvieramos mala suerte.<//Text>
